When your immune system is strong, you may not notice it at work, but when it's weakened, symptoms of illness can soon follow. Maintaining a [healthy body](https://newsnetwork.mayoclinic.org/discussion/mayo-clinic-minute-how-to-be-healthier-in-2022/?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) often starts by taking the steps to give your immune system a boost. Between seasonal illnesses and the [COVID-19](https://newsnetwork.mayoclinic.org/category/covid-19/?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) pandemic, your immune system may be top of mind. "Return to basic healthy lifestyle principles: Eating well and sleeping, while reducing stress and trying to stay physically active," says [Dr. Stephen McMullan](https://www.mayoclinic.org/biographies/mcmullan-stephen-m-m-d/bio-20490622?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721), a [Mayo Clinic](https://www.mayoclinic.org/?mc_id=us&utm_source=newsnetwork&utm_medium=l&utm_content=content&utm_campaign=mayoclinic&geo=national&placementsite=enterprise&invsrc=other&cauid=100721) family medicine physician. Your immune system requires care and is not something you can give a lasting boost overnight, so don't rush to the cabinet for pills or powders. "I think a misconception is that there are supplements or products out there that can really boost the immune system. Unfortunately, they haven't really had robust evidence that they're highly effective," says Dr. McMullan. Think about long-term adjustments to your lifestyle: a [diet](https://www.mayoclinichealthsystem.org/hometown-health/speaking-of-health/support-your-immune-function-with-good-nutrition) that includes lean proteins, seven to nine hours of sleep nightly, daily exercise, and eliminating stressors in your life. The results can help you stay healthy past seasonal illnesses. "Healthy lifestyles can also reduce the risk for certain diseases like high blood pressure, heart disease, strokes, cancer and diabetes," says Dr. McMullan.
